definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: The disappointments of life can knock us down.
sentences.chinese: 生活中种种不如意真的可以打倒我们。

sentences.english: Ruggam felled him with his shovel .
sentences.chinese: 拉根一铲子把他打倒在地。

sentences.english: Dong Hongchang was shot down by the black man in prison, Liao Shaoxia was rescued.
sentences.chinese: 董洪昌被黑衣人开枪打倒在监狱中，廖少侠被救出。

sentences.english: It has scored a knockout win over token ring.
sentences.chinese: 它已取得了决定性的胜利，打倒了令牌环网。

sentences.english: Armed with a stouthearted spirit, the little boy was able to knock the giant down.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩用刚毅的精神鼓舞自己，然后把巨人打倒了。

sentences.english: The true life, will not be lived overthrows .
sentences.chinese: 真正的人生，是不会被生活打倒的。

sentences.english: As Visser is about to emerge, she fires through the door, and Visser falls.
sentences.chinese: 当维瑟出现时，她隔着门开枪把维瑟打倒。

sentences.english: Defeat 100 players using physical attacks in Versus.
sentences.chinese: 使用体术攻击打倒100人次玩家。

sentences.english: I am mortally sorry you are not worth knocking down.
sentences.chinese: 非常抱歉，但你不值得让我打倒。

sentences.english: I got to my feet and tried to fight back but another blow sent me flying.
sentences.chinese: 我挣扎着站起来并且打算还手，但又是一拳将我打倒。

sentences.english: Out of that discordance arises the consciousness of a new class, and with its rise to self-consciousness the fall of ownership begins.
sentences.chinese: 这种新阶级意识的自觉性，就是打倒所有权的前提。

sentences.english: A shopkeeper is in hospital after being clubbed to the ground with a baseball bat.
sentences.chinese: 店主被棒球棒打倒在地以后，进了医院。

sentences.english: But did pull out the sword yingzhen jie, but was soon down.
sentences.chinese: 胤杰无奈拔剑应战，但很快就被打倒。

sentences.english: One good blow would topple him over and down and out.
sentences.chinese: 只要好好的一拳，就能把他打倒，叫他完蛋。

sentences.english: I knew you would overthrow me in the end.
sentences.chinese: 我早知道你最终会把我打倒。

sentences.english: The cameraman and numerous pilots are gunned down by the Zeros twice.
sentences.chinese: 那个摄影记者和几名飞行员被零式飞机打倒两次。

definition: to defeat/to overpower/to beat/to be defeated
to run off rebuffed/to fend off/(to fight off and make sb) run off
to hack to death/to kill with an ax
